content.description:
Start on

Totally High Maintenance

and link into

Hysteria

at sixth bolt. This variation avoids the crux of

Hysteria

but climbs the excellent, hard 5.11, sustained finish.
content.protection: Bolts. Bring some long slings to avoid rope drag (6th bolt).

content.description:
Start by climbing the gamble oak leaning against the rock. Step on to rock, traversing right to corner/arete. This shares the first four bolts with

Hysteria

(12b) which forks off left from the ledge.
content.protection: Twelve bolts, lower from the anchor 30m.
content.location: This is 50 feet north of waterfall - look for the oak tree start.

content.description:
This is the route that is on the left, and it climbs the face.

Do two single rope rappels to the ground.

Climb the gamble oak leaning against the rock to start.  Four bolts protect the traversing slab and arete/corner. Continue from the ledge up the techy slab into the shallow corner (hard) and water streak. This shares first four bolts and anchor with "

Totally High Maintenance

" which forks off right from ledge.
content.location: This is 50 feet left of waterfall - start on a tree. Lower from anchor 30m.

content.description: Start 15 feet left of the waterfall by balancing up on a broken off oak and clipping first bolt.  The first moves are cruxy.  Moderate runouts over bolts lead to a corner and another crux up high - bring small cams.
content.protection: It protects with bolts and gear to 1.5".  Lower from anchors.

content.description: Like the dodgy vixen we all know, this leads you to believe that it's going to be easy and sweet.  Then it starts getting kind of gnarly and then really friken' difficult.  Start by liebacking the gamble oak leaning against the lip of the cave.  Hop on the rock clipping bolts across the slab and up the corner/arete (use a long sling on the fourth bolt).  Traverse the ledge right, to the obvious bolt line, (long slings on fifth and eighth bolts) through soft huecos and a big overhang and headwall.
content.protection: Twelve bolts. Bring three long slings for the fourth, fifth, and eighth bolts to reduce rope drag. There are fixed anchor with biners for lowering. There are security cameras afixed on the anchor to catch biner thieves (slow death penalty).  If you take biners 'cause they're worn out, leave your own then.
content.location:
50 feet left of the waterfall, look for the big gamble oak leaning against the lip of the cave. This shares the start (first four bolts) with

Hysteria

and

Totally High Maintenance

.

content.description:
Start off the berm just off the trail. The first bolt has to be stick clipped. There are no holds to climb into the first bolt from the ground. After clipping the first bolt, start just below the bolt with your feet on two good features. From there, follow incredible, grippy, patina features straight up past 6 bolts to a two bolt chain anchor just below an overhaning cap rock.

There is a new stick clip attached to the large pine tree on the downhill side. Please keep this in that area. Thanks!
content.location: This is on the left side of the Waterfall and Overlook areas, just eight feet to the left of the unnamed drilled piton route before you get to "The Matrix" (Marcus Garcia). Walk up the burm to the left of the trail to access both these routes.

content.description: Route on the right that climbs the arete.  Two single rope rappels to the ground.
content.location: Bolted route to be edited in.

content.description: The crux is a throw between the first and second bolt on a steep section, the route traverses left under the roof and out, up to ledge.
content.location:
Awakening is the second route past the water fall when walking to Apple Cider area. Currently, there is a rock bench seat at the base of this climb. From the anchor of Awakening, there are two sport routes that are good second pitches, the one on the right is called

Totally High Maintenance

. Awakening could be linked to either of these pitches, but drag may be an issue.
